Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Eli Mansour, The Edmond J. Safra Synagogue, 1801 Ocean Parkway, Brooklyn, NY 11223.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Treyger.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Eli Mansour, The Edmond J. Safra Synagogue, 1801 Ocean Parkway, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11223.  



Council Member Treyger moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 25, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Ulrich.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Ulrich moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 25, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Resolution recognizing and commemorating January 13th as Korean American Day in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing and commemorating January 13th as Korean American Day in NYC.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the Mayor, the Mayor’s Office of Environmental Coordination, the New York City Planning Commission, the New York City Department of City Planning, and all other relevant City agencies to re-examine the standards in the CEQR regulations and the Technical Manual for assessing when a possible adverse impact on a neighborhood’s character or socioeconomic status requires a detailed analysis and possible mitigation, and calling on the relevant agencies, when such significant adverse impacts are identified, consistently to seek mitigation or development alternatives that provide long-term or permanent protection for the residents, businesses, and character of the affected community, including through the provision of permanently affordable housing and commercial space.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Re-examine the standards in the CEQR regulations and the Technical Manual.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to enact, an amendment to the State Education Law that mandates a firm, common deadline for all charter school applications and a common lottery date for any charter schools using lottery admissions, or alternatively, to pass legislation allowing New York City to enact such a law locally.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: State Education Law to mandate a firm, common deadline for all charter school applications and a common lottery date for any charter schools using lottery admissions, or alternatively, to pass legislation allowing NYC to enact such a law locally.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact an amendment to the New York State Charter Schools Act requiring charter schools to fill any vacancies created by departing students, at any grade level, if students remain on the charter school’s wait-list, or alternatively, to pass legislation allowing New York City to enact such a law locally.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYS Charter Schools Act requiring charter schools to fill any vacancies created by departing students, at any grade level, if students remain on the charter school’s wait-list, or alternatively, to pass legislation allowing NYC to enact such a law locally

Items.MatterName: Establishing term limits for community board members.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
